word_mean: 舵，附设于船体外，用以对船施加回转力矩，控制和调整航向的翼状装置。
垂直尾翼后部可左右偏转的舵面。
舵，利用船舶航行时作用于舵叶上的流体动力而控制船舶航向的装置。通常由舵叶和舵杆组成。

sentence.Network_en: It was not yet clear how the rudder had sheared off.
sentence.Network_cn: 还不清楚船舵是如何断裂的。

sentence.Network_en: Turn the rudder slightly so that we can ease the boat round.
sentence.Network_cn: 慢慢掌舵,这样我们就能使船稳稳地拐过去.

sentence.Network_en: An oar often acts as rudder.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rōther 'paddle, oar', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch roer, German Ruder, also to the verb row

entry.def: A rudder is a device for steering a boat. It consists of a vertical piece of wood or metal at the back of the boat.
An aeroplane's rudder is a vertical piece of metal at the back which is used to make the plane turn to the right or to the left.

means.word_mean: 1. a hinged vertical airfoil mounted at the tail of an aircraft and used to make horizontal course changes
2. (nautical) steering mechanism consisting of a hinged vertical plate mounted at the stern of a vessel

sentences.en: An oar often acts as rudder.
A sailor uses the rudder to make the ship go in the correct direction.
Some tried to stop up the leaks while others tried to steady the rudder.
sentences.cn: 一些人设法堵漏洞,另一些人设法掌稳船舵。
